contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "David's wives gave birth to six sons" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Sons were born to David

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "he had more sons and daughters" or "they bore him more sons and daughters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: more sons and daughters were born to him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "people told King David" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: King David was told

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "But the slave girls of whom you have spoken will honor me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: But by these slave girls you have spoken about, I will be honored

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "may you do what you promised to me and my family, and may your promise never change" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: may the promise that you made concerning your servant and his family be established forever

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "is secure because of you" or "continues because of you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: is established before you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "when the Arameans realized that the Israelites were defeating them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: When the Arameans saw that they were being defeated by Israel

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "When David heard about this" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: When David was told this

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The Israelites wounded Shobach the commander of the Aramean army, and he died there" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Shobach the commander of their army was wounded and died there

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "realized that the Israelites had defeated them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: saw that they were defeated by Israel

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "including Uriah the Hittite" (UDB) or "and the men of the city also killed Uriah the Hittite" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and Uriah the Hittite was also killed there

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they killed some of the king's servants" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: some of the king's servants were killed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they killed your servant Uriah the Hittite" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: your servant Uriah the Hittite was killed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. Sometimes men died because of their sins, but he will not die because of his sin with the woman. This can be stated clearly. AT: "You will not die" or "you will not die because of this sin" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: You will not be killed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They placed the crown on David's own head" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The crown was placed on David's own head

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will take care of this matter for you" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I will command something to be done for you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "people praised Absalom for his handsomeness more than they praised anyone else" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: there was no one praised for his handsomeness more than Absalom

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "who he had invited" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who were invited

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. Also, the all of the soldiers in Israel are referred to here as "all Israel." AT: "that you should gather together all of the Israelite soldiers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: that all Israel should be gathered together to you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Absalom had not followed his advice" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: his advice had not been followed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they buried him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: was buried

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "There the soldiers of David defeated the army of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The army of Israel was defeated there before the soldiers of David

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Someone told Joab" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Joab was told

contextId.information: This is an exaggeration, it means most of the men. It can be stated in active form. AT: "many of the men who were there heard others saying" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: all the people were told

contextId.information: This may be stated in active form. AT: "After the man took Amasa off the road" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: After Amasa was taken off the road

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "allow your men to give seven of his descendants to us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: let seven men from his descendants be handed over to us

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the one whom Yahweh chose" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the one chosen by Yahweh

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "whom the Gibeonites executed by hanging" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who had been hanged

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "who is worthy to receive praise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who is worthy to be praised

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "because God's anger shook them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and were shaken, because God was angry

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Foreigners bowed down to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Foreigners were forced to bow to me

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People often mentioned him when they spoke about the three bravest men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: He was often mentioned along with the three soldiers

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "people praise him like they praised the three mighty men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he was named alongside the three mighty men

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "so that Yahweh will remove this plague from the people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so that the plague may be removed from the people
